mim.author: ESHAZON
mim.name: Router6000Equipment
mim.description: R6000K Equipment model inherited from ECIM Equipment Fragment 2.1

struct.name: Position
struct.description: Used to indicate the placement of a physical element.

structMember.name: name
structMember.description: Defines a label for the position.

structMember.name: physicalPosition
structMember.description: Indicates the placement of a physical element. It can specify slot information on a hosting board, mounting site in cabinet or latitude/longitude.

enum.name: AvailabilityStatus
enum.description: The availability status is used to qualify the operational state. It indicates why the operational state has changed its value to disabled.

enumMember.name: NO_STATUS
enumMember.description: The resource is fully operational. The operational state is enabled.

enumMember.name: IN_TEST
enumMember.description: The resource is undergoing a test procedure. If the administrative state is locked or shutting down then normal users are precluded from using the resource.

enumMember.name: FAILED
enumMember.description: The resource has an internal fault that prevents it from operating. The operational state is disabled.

enumMember.name: POWER_OFF
enumMember.description: The resource requires power to be applied and is not powered on. For example, a fuse or other protection device is known to have removed power or a low voltage condition has been detected. The operational state is disabled.

enumMember.name: OFF_LINE
enumMember.description: The resource requires a routine operation to be performed to make it available. The operation may be manual or automatic, or both. The operational state is disabled.

enumMember.name: OFF_DUTY
enumMember.description: The resource has been made inactive in accordance with a predetermined time schedule. Under normal conditions the control process can be expected to reactivate the resource at some scheduled time, and it is therefore considered to be optional. The operational state is enabled or disabled.

enumMember.name: DEGRADED
enumMember.description: The service available from the resource is degraded in some respect. The degradation can for instance be in speed or operating capacity. Failure of a test or an unacceptable performance measurement has established that some or all services are not functional or are degraded due to the presence of a defect. However, the resource remains available for service, either because some services are satisfactory or because degraded service is preferable to no service at all. Object specific attributes may be defined to represent further information indicating, for example, which services are not functional and the nature of the degradation. The operational state is enabled.

enumMember.name: LOG_FULL
enumMember.description: This indicates a log full condition. The semantics of are defined in CCITT Rec. X.735 | ISO/IEC 10164-6.

enumMember.name: DEPENDANCY
enumMember.description: The resource cannot operate because some other resource on which it depends is unavailable. The resource it depends on is not represented by the same managed object. For example, a device is not accessible because its controller is powered off. The operational state is disabled.

enumMember.name: ROUTER6675_1_10GE_24_100GE_4_BCM_V1_CARD
enumMember.description: R6675 contains 24 10GE ports and 1 100GE port in the main board

enum.name: ResetType
enum.description:
Indicates the type of HW reset to be performed.
Possible values: 0 SOFT 1 HARD 2 FACTORYDEFAULT

enumMember.name: HARD
enumMember.description: Restart where the power is cycled (turned on and off or the equivalent).

enumMember.name: FACTORY_DEFAULT
enumMember.description: A HARD reset followed by resetting the hardware is reset to the factory default settings.

enum.name: FanPerformanceStatus
enum.description: The performance status of the fan

enumMember.name: ENABLED
enumMember.description: Fan is working and performance is good.

enumMember.name: POWERSAVE
enumMember.description: No power to fans, power saving mode.

enum.name: ActiveAlarmSignal
enum.description:
Defines the active signal type of the InputAlarmIO MO.
Possible values: 1: HIGH 2: LOW

enum.name: OperState
enum.description: The operational states of a resource.

enumMember.name: ENABLED
enumMember.description: The resource is partially or fully operable.

attribute.name: equipmentId
attribute.description: Unique identifier for this object instance.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: User friendly name for equipment object.

class.name: Slot
class.description: This MO is used to represent a slot.

action.name: getHardwareItem
action.description:
Retrieves hardware inventory information for the instance.
The operation is used to retrieve the inventory information for a particular piece of equipment. It returns a reference to the hardwareItem MO from the HW Inventory fragment.

attribute.name: slotId
attribute.description: Unique identifier for this object instance.

attribute.name: holdingHWExpected
attribute.description:
Is used to restrict the type of hardware that the slot supports.
The attribute holdingHWExpected allows for pre-provisioning of hardware that will be inserted into the slot. This is a string whose acceptable values are listed within the attribute typeOfHw plus a particular value “emptySlot” that means that no ReplaceableUnit must be present within this slot. The attribute is used for manually configuring the replaceable unit in this slot.

attribute.name: holdingHWActual
attribute.description:
Is a string that represents the hardware that is currently inserted in the slot.
The allowed values are the same as for holdingHWExpected plus the value “unknown”. It is a read-only attribute that exports the detected replaceable unit type. Normally there is no mismatch between attributes holdingHWExpected and holdingHWActual but both the case where the equipment can detect the replaceable unit insertion is considered, as well as the case where the replaceable unit is different from the expected unit.

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: User friendly name for the equipment object.

attribute.name: typeOfHw
attribute.description:
Free-form string that identifies the object instance hardware type.
It is recommended that the content of this attribute is given a standard Ericsson product number and revision, e.g. ROJ 208 842/3 R2B.

class.name: Shelf
class.description: This MO is used to represent a shelf.

action.name: getHardwareItem
action.description:
Retrieves hardware inventory information for the instance.
The operation is used to retrieve the inventory information for a particular piece of equipment. It returns a reference to the hardwareItem MO from the HW Inventory fragment.

attribute.name: shelfId
attribute.description: Unique identifier for this object instance.

attribute.name: maxNumberOfSlots
attribute.description: Defines the number of physical slots available in the shelf.

attribute.name: position
attribute.description: Position

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: User friendly name for the equipment object.

attribute.name: typeOfHw
attribute.description:
Free-form string that identifies the object instance hardware type.
It is recommended that the content of this attribute is given a standard Ericsson product number and revision, e.g. ROJ 208 842/3 R2B.

class.name: FanModule
class.description: This MO is used to represent a fan module.

action.name: getHardwareItem
action.description:
Retrieves hardware inventory information for the instance.
The operation is used to retrieve the inventory information for a particular piece of equipment. It returns a reference to the hardwareItem MO from the HW Inventory fragment.

attribute.name: fanModuleId
attribute.description: Fan module ID

attribute.name: fanNumber
attribute.description: Indicates the number of fans present on the module.

attribute.name: fanPerformanceStatus
attribute.description: Indicates the performance status of any fan within module.

attribute.name: fanSpeed
attribute.description: Current speed in rpm of each fan.

attribute.name: availStatus
attribute.description: Available Status

attribute.name: userLabel
attribute.description: User friendly name for the equipment object.

attribute.name: typeOfHw
attribute.description:
Free-form string that identifies the object instance hardware type.
It is recommended that the content of this attribute is given a standard Ericsson product number and revision, e.g. ROJ 208 842/3 R2B.

action.name: reset
action.description: Used to restart the HW entity. This action takes two parameters resetType and gracefulReset.

parameter.name: resetType
parameter.description:
Type of reset
Possible values: SOFT = restart the hardware without removing power. HARD = restart the hardware where the power is cycled (turned on and off or the equivalent). FACTORY_DEFAULT = restart the hardware where the power is cycled (turned on and off or the equivalent) and the hardware is reset to the factory default settings.

parameter.name: gracefulReset
parameter.description: Boolean that if true specifies a graceful reset. E.g., allows time to execute a shutdown sequence.

action.description:
Retrieves hardware inventory information for the instance.
The operation is used to retrieve the inventory information for a particular piece of equipment. It returns a reference to the hardwareItem MO from the HW Inventory fragment.

attribute.name: administrativeState

attribute.description: The temperature of the Power Module

attribute.name: inputId
attribute.description: Input alarm IO port ID

attribute.name: activeSignal
attribute.description: The active signal type

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: The description, which is used when the alarm is raised.

attribute.name: adminState
attribute.description: The alarm administrative state

attribute.name: severity
attribute.description: The alarm severity for the raised alarm.

class.name: AlarmPort
class.description: The alarm port for the external alarm IO.

attribute.name: alarmPortId
attribute.description: The unique Id of the alarm port

attribute.name: connectorType
attribute.description: The type of peripheral connector, for example GPIO, RJ45, RS232 or USB etc.

attribute.name: numberOfInputPin
attribute.description: The number of the pins those are used to input alarm port

attribute.name: numberOfOutputPin
attribute.description: The number of the pins those are used to output alarm port

attribute.name: outputId
attribute.description: The output alarm IO port ID

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: The description

attribute.name: adminState
attribute.description: The alarm administrative state

class.name: AttachedUnit
class.description: The Attached Unit which will be attached to R6000 ethernet port. It runs the specific service. However it is managed through R6000 north bound.

action.name: reset
action.description: Used to restart the HW entity. This action takes two parameters resetType and gracefulReset.

parameter.name: resetType
parameter.description:
Type of reset
Possible values: SOFT = restart the hardware without removing power. HARD = restart the hardware where the power is cycled (turned on and off or the equivalent). FACTORY_DEFAULT = restart the hardware where the power is cycled (turned on and off or the equivalent) and the hardware is reset to the factory default settings.

parameter.name: gracefulReset
parameter.description: Boolean that if true specifies a graceful reset. E.g., allows time to execute a shutdown sequence.

action.name: getHardwareItem
action.description:
Retrieves hardware inventory information for the instance.
The operation is used to retrieve the inventory information for a particular piece of equipment. It returns a reference to the hardwareItem MO from the HW Inventory fragment.

attribute.name: connectedAUType
attribute.description: The actualy connected AU Type.

attribute.name: configuredAUType
attribute.description: Currently only TDM AU is supported by R6000.

attribute.name: temp
attribute.description: The temperature of the AU.

attribute.name: attachedPort
attribute.description: the ethernet port where the AU is attached to. It should be like slot/port.

attribute.name: timeOfConnection
attribute.description: Time in us to show how long the AU is connected to R6000.

attribute.name: timeOfRunning
attribute.description: Time in us to show how long the AU is running.
